newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Commodities stand out in Brazil August exports.
newsitem.headline: Commodities stand out in Brazil August exports.

text.p: Shipments of coffee and soybean stood out among Brazilian exports during the month of August, the Ministry of Industry and Commerce said.
The ministry said that despite delays in shipments, soybean sales rose 31.48 percent over August 1995, reaching $472 million in value.
However, soybean sales did come in 15 percent lower than in July, when $556 million worth was shipped. The ministry did not give figures in tonnes.
The ministry said coffee exports also made gains despite a fall of about 8.0 percent in international prices over July.
Coffee exports, as given in tonnes, were 94,000 tonnes compared with 71,000 tonnes in July. The value of the exports rose to $190 million compared with $155 million in July.
Sugar exports also rose in August from July. The ministry said granulated sugar exports rose 18 percent to 532,000 tonnes from 450,000 tonnes.
Total exports in August were $4.381 billion, with primary commodities accounting for 27.66 percent.
